definition: Lord Kelvin 1824-1907, British physicist (William Thomson)/Kelvin (temperature scale)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The experiments were conducted in an ultra-high vacuum at the low temperature of 10 Kelvin, with the use of liquid helium.
sentences.chinese: 此次实验是在10开尔文低温的超真空环境中完成的。

sentences.english: Lord Kelvin was missing half the story.
sentences.chinese: 开尔文勋爵少算了一半。

sentences.english: If I would heat you up to 3,000 degrees Kelvin, you would become red-hot.
sentences.chinese: 3000开尔文，你会变成一个红点，你事实上。

sentences.english: Let's draw it in degrees Kelvin, instead of in degrees Celsius.
sentences.chinese: 来重画一下这幅图，现在温度的单位是开尔文。

sentences.english: And then you would get the Kelvin scale.
Consequently the modern mission movement has been partly aresult of the decline of Calvinistic dogmatism.
sentences.chinese: 因此，现代传道的发展是开尔文教条衰退的一个结果。

sentences.english: He knew he had found Lord Kelvin’s unknown source of heat.
sentences.chinese: 他知道他发现了开尔文勋爵所说的来源不明的热量。

sentences.english: Where do Kelvin waves come from?

definition: thermodynamic temperature scale (in degrees Kelvin, measured above absolute zero)
Planck's constant h, approximately equal to 6.626 x 10^-34 joule.seconds or 4.135 x 10^-15 electron volt.seconds
Rudolf Clausius (1822-1888), German physicist and mathematician

definition: Fermi (name)/Enrico Fermi (1901-1954), Italian born US nuclear physicist
